entry.title: Contribute to N3N
entry.summary: The N3N division contributor guidelines is an invitation letter to all the people out there who believes in the power of technology through contribution, making lives better for everyone.

entry.title: Contributor Terms
entry.summary: Contribute to N3N projects with the assurance that your work is appreciated, protected by clear licensing terms, and aligned with a collaborative and respectful community, as outlined in our Contributor Terms.

entry.title: Guide to DCO
entry.summary: In the vibrant realm of open-source development, collaboration is key. To streamline contributions and ensure a harmonious coding environment, many projects adopt the Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO). This certificate, often abbreviated as DCO, serves as a guideline for contributors, fostering a culture of openness and clarity.

entry.title: Vendoring Guide
entry.summary: Managing dependencies is a crucial aspect of maintaining healthy and sustainable open-source projects. This document outlines guidelines for effective vendoring in N3N projects, providing clarity on versioning, tagging, and maintaining changelogs.

entry.title: FAQ
entry.summary: Welcome to the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) section! Here, we've compiled answers to some common queries about N3N. If you can't find what you're looking for, feel free to ask in the relevant channel or reach out to our support.

entry.title: Join Us at N3N!
entry.summary: Are you passionate about open source, cybersecurity, and making a positive impact in the tech community? Join us at N3N â€“ where collaborative development meets innovation!

entry.title: Our Mission
entry.summary: N3N is on a mission to empower a secure digital future, fostering innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity in our community-driven pursuit of privacy and cybersecurity excellence.
